item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): New Gold Plated DIN Plug
item.description:
During the ongoing refurbishment of a Beogram 4002 (5513) turntable, a corroded DIN5 plug was replaced after a new output relay had been installed. The original plug showed significant signs of wear. A high-quality Rean DIN5 plug with gold-plated terminals was chosen as a replacement. Photos document the preparation of the cable and the installation process. The author notes the limited space inside the DIN5 plug, making it difficult to separate the signal and ground connections...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5513-new-gold-plated-din-plug/

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5501): Replacing the Original DIN5 Plug with a Modern All-Metal Gold Plated Unit
item.description:
To fully restore a 4002, replacing the often corroded DIN5 connector is essential. The delicate low-voltage signals need optimal contact. Gold is an ideal material due to its resistance to oxidation, ensuring a strong and long-lasting connection. The pictures illustrate this process, showing the old connector’s condition, preparing the cable for the new connector, the soldering process, and finally, the pristine new gold-plated connector installed. This upgrade is a significant step towards bringing the Beogram back to its former glory...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5501-replacing-the-original-din5-plug-with-a-modern-all-metal-gold-plated-unit/

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5514): Installation of a New DIN5 Plug With Gold Coated Terminals
item.description:
My Beogram 4002 (5514) restoration is coming along nicely. I believe a key part of revitalizing these turntables is installing a new, all-metal DIN 5 plug with gold-plated contacts. The old plugs often suffer from corrosion, which hinders the delicate signal transfer from the MMC cartridge. For example, here’s a picture of the old plug with tarnished terminals: This image showcases the soldering work within the updated plug: And finally, the finished product:..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5514-installation-of-a-new-din5-plug-with-gold-coated-terminals/

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5503): Installation of a New All-Metal DIN5 Plug with Gold Plated Contacts
item.description:
I believe that any restoration of a Beogram 4002 isn’t truly finished until the old output plugs, which are often corroded, are replaced with modern, all-metal ones featuring gold-plated terminals. High-quality analog signals deserve the best possible connections. Here are some photos documenting the DIN5 plug replacement I completed on a Beogram 4002 (5503) restoration: The original DIN5 plug is shown here: This photo shows the “under the hood” soldering work:..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5503-installation-of-a-new-all-metal-din5-plug-with-gold-plated-contacts/

item.title: Beogram 4000: Upgrade of Signal Path with New DIN5 Plug and a Grounding Switch
item.description:
The DIN5 plug on the Beogram 4000 being restored was heavily oxidized and needed replacement. A new, fully metal plug with gold-plated terminals was installed. To improve the signal output, a switch was added to connect the signal and system grounds. This feature is beneficial when using a DIN5 to RCA adapter, as RCA cables lack a system ground. Connecting the system ground to the signal ground on the Beogram can reduce humming...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4000-upgrade-of-signal-path-with-new-din5-plug-and-a-grounding-switch/

item.title: Beocord 9000: Repair of a Broken Out DIN-7 Jack With 3D Printed Inserts
item.description:
Repairing the broken DIN 7 jack on the Beocord 9000 was simpler than anticipated. The part is identical to the one used for the Beomaster 8000’s Phono input. A 3D printed part, designed previously, was used to replace the fragile tabs on these sockets, which often break and cause the jack to fall into the panel cutout. Images of the broken jack and the 3D printed replacements are included. A short video demonstrating the installation process and the repaired plug is provided...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beocord-9000-repair-of-a-broken-out-din-7-jack-with-3d-printed-inserts/

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Replacing the DIN 5 Cable with a Cable Featuring RCA Plugs
item.description:
I am rebuilding a Beogram 4002(5513) turntable to use with a McIntosh Preamplifier. The standard DIN5 connector on Bang & Olufsen equipment is incompatible, so I am replacing it with RCA connectors for the best shielding and lowest EMI. Direct installation inside the turntable offers superior performance compared to adapters. For optimal sound, I chose high-quality, open-ended RCA cables from Sounds Heavenly in the UK. These cables feature individually shielded, twisted-pair left and right channels, embodying an “audiophile” design...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5513-replacing-the-din-5-cable-with-a-cable-featuring-rca-plugs/

item.title: Beogram 4000: A New DIN 5 Plug and Installation of a Grounding Switch
item.description:
The Beogram 4000 I’m currently restoring had a severely corroded and improperly installed DIN 5 plug, clearly not the original. The attached photos illustrate its poor condition. One of the pictures highlights a loose black wire, potentially a makeshift attempt to address humming issues (unsurprising given the plug’s installation). Adding to the problem, a poorly executed soldering job had left one of the signal leads disconnected. I removed the old plug and prepared the wires for a new one, as shown in the photo...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4000-a-new-din-5-plug-and-installation-of-a-grounding-switch/

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Installation of New DIN5 Plug with Gold Plated Pins
item.description:
A gold-plated plug is the finishing touch for a fully restored signal path. Here’s the process on a Beogram 4002(5513) I’m currently working on: Above is the original plug in rough shape due to oxidation. The new Rean plug offers a neat and tidy internal layout. Placing the metal enclosure back results in an even more visually appealing look. That’s the Beolove!..
